channel.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
channel.description:
[center][b][size=12pt]MoparClassic[/size][/b][/center]
[b]What is MoparClassic?[/b] MoparClassic is the official moparscape runescape classic server.
[b]What is the point of MoparClassic?[/b] MoparClassic was created in response to the poor servers that spawn today. Unlike traditional private servers, MoparClassic aims to provide a fair game environment.
[b]Why is it not released?[/b] The only thing holding MoparClassic from being released is the community. MoparClassic is a community server, this means that anybody can contribute. Since MoparClassic relies on the community, if the community fails, so does the server. (As we have experienced...) If you are interested in further advancing the source, you can view all current issues [url=https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/issues?labels=Bug&state=open]here[/url].
[b]Where can I find the source code?[/b] Source : https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/tree/pre-beta
[b]I would like to contribute, how do I go about doing this?[/b] You can fork the project on github, make your edits and submit a pull request.
[b]If I contribute, is there some kind of reward?[/b] Yes, but details about our rewards will not be handed out.
[b]I heard there is a private forum section for this project? Can I have access?[/b] You can request access in this thread.
[b]Can I use the source to create my own server?[/b] Yes. Another great thing about MoparClassic is that you can use it for your own private use. We understand that it negatively effects MoparClassic since "rival" servers can appear, but we also understand it's for the better. If you use the source for your own pleasure, we hope that you post all issues with the source [url=https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/issues?labels=Bug&state=open]here[/url].
[b]Where can I find the client?[/b] Official Client : https://github.com/xetr0v/mpc-client
[b]How do I change the clients data files?[/b] Since MoparClassic is a replica of the original version of runescape, we have not bothered to mess with the cache. You can read up on decompressing bzip2 files, or use a rscangel/dq client.

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:35, topic:455743”]The MySQL auto account registration was never made functional. The reddit bot authentication is not documented to be viable without hours of trial and error. sha512(sha515(padToLength20(pass))) has not worked when trying to generate password hashes for the MySQL database either.[/quote]Not sure why you can’t get passwords to work, but I literally just tried it and got it working.

I just did what was said to do in the following issue:

github.com/MoparClassic/MoparClassic

Issue: MySQL user needs created if it doesn't exist

opened by moparisthebest on 2012-03-16
closed by Rodgerwilco on 
When using DummyAuth, or WebsiteAuth for example, the user is authorized but login fails because they don't exist in the MySQL...

It got past the auth but I CBA adding data manually to the exp tables to see if login fully works.

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

The MySQL auto account registration was never made functional. The reddit bot authentication is not documented to be viable without hours of trial and error. sha512(sha515(padToLength20(pass))) has not worked when trying to generate password hashes for the MySQL database either.

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“sin, post:29, topic:455743”]Hey guys I have this server running and am able to login and connect to it with the mpc-client! I’m wondering how much of this server is completed? I see there are no quests but the system is there to implement them, does this mean things like smithing don’t yet work? Can anyone point me in the direction of helpful threads regarding this base or is there not much information on it yet and I should just be learning as I go? At this point my next step is to setup the server on a VPS/Dedicated server so I can start building the character creation part of the website and integrating it for login/registration.

Do most people usually replicate the old quests or is it easier to just build all new content?

I see there is a Username.Json file is this the only way to tell what the person has in their inventory? It doesn’t seem to be updated in real time.

Thanks for any help I can get![/quote]Take a look at the readme, there is a lot of helpful information in there.

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

To be honest with you I was largely uninvolved in making source code changes. Those who were working on it aren’t around much anymore.
I’m not sure how fit for use/purpose it is, but you’re pretty much on your own.

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @sin sin
item.description:
@sin wrote:

Hey guys I have this server running and am able to login and connect to it with the mpc-client! I’m wondering how much of this server is completed? I see there are no quests but the system is there to implement them, does this mean things like smithing don’t yet work? Can anyone point me in the direction of helpful threads regarding this base or is there not much information on it yet and I should just be learning as I go? At this point my next step is to setup the server on a VPS/Dedicated server so I can start building the character creation part of the website and integrating it for login/registration.

Do most people usually replicate the old quests or is it easier to just build all new content?

I see there is a Username.Json file is this the only way to tell what the person has in their inventory? It doesn’t seem to be updated in real time.

Thanks for any help I can get!

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“ExiledNoob, post:27, topic:455743”]Aww… I thought MoparScape had a RSC server up and running for me to play
sadface… i dont wanna play rsc revoluton or rscevolution or whatever the hell it’s called.

Someone should re-upload the source and client so I can get to work and see what kind of masterpiece I can make!
I started playing RS durring the RSC era. Kept the same account for 12 years and still play on it today. It has access to jagex’s “veteran world 1” on runescape classic and everything. So needless to say, I know Classic pretty well and would love to work on my own private project[/quote]

Good for you the repo’s are available on github.

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“jrbtfc, post:21, topic:455743”]Looking for some guidance here.

I’ve downloaded the Lothy MoparClassic here: https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic

Now, I’m reading this and other pages mentioning the “auth.php” file.

Was this supposed to come with MoparClassic? Either way, I am only able to find it within xampp. Github offers a preview of what is in the download, and I can see that it’s not in there on Lothy MoparClassic.

There is an auth.php in C:\xampp\php\pear
There is an auth.php in C:\xampp\php\pear\Auth
There is an auth.php in C:\xampp\php\pear\PEAR\Command

I suppose I’m confused because I’m reading that I should be copying auth.php FROM MoparClassic > LoginSErver TO xampp www files.

Any advice?

The other thing is when I find this correct auth.php, do I copy to C:\xampp\perl\vendor\lib\www or C:\xampp\perl\vendor\lib\auto\www?

Or am I doing this entire thing incorrectly?[/quote]There are different ways to authenticate users. You probably shouldn’t be using that one. Just stick to the default configs for the LS, and you should be fine. Also, the most current documentation is the GitHub’s README.md.

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @jrbtfc jrbtfc
item.description:
@jrbtfc wrote:

Looking for some guidance here.

I’ve downloaded the Lothy MoparClassic here: https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic

Now, I’m reading this and other pages mentioning the “auth.php” file.

Was this supposed to come with MoparClassic? Either way, I am only able to find it within xampp. Github offers a preview of what is in the download, and I can see that it’s not in there on Lothy MoparClassic.

There is an auth.php in C:\xampp\php\pear
There is an auth.php in C:\xampp\php\pear\Auth
There is an auth.php in C:\xampp\php\pear\PEAR\Command

I suppose I’m confused because I’m reading that I should be copying auth.php FROM MoparClassic > LoginSErver TO xampp www files.

Any advice?

The other thing is when I find this correct auth.php, do I copy to C:\xampp\perl\vendor\lib\www or C:\xampp\perl\vendor\lib\auto\www?

Or am I doing this entire thing incorrectly?

Read full topic

item.title: [Info]MoparClassic - RSC source
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Fork the project.
Use gitgui to import the project from YOUR github to your local workspace
Import with eclipse.
Make changes…
Use gitgui to commit changes.
Use gitgui to push…
Submit pull request (your changes to the official mscp/lothy github)
Collect irl moneys.

Read full topic
